title: Walter Shipley Led Mergers of Some of the Biggest U.S. Banks
summary: CEO, standing 6-foot-8, was credited with facilitating deals by keeping his ego in check. Walter Shipley, a self-effacing chief executive who led some of the biggest bank mergers of the 1980s and 1990s and managed to keep a low profile despite standing 6-foot-8, died Friday in Jacksonville, Fla., where he had a home.

title: Government Workers Turn to Emergency Loans
summary: Financial institutions offer no-interest packages, waived fees for overdrafts and early withdrawals from CDs.

title: Julián Castro, Former Housing Secretary, Announces 2020 Presidential Bid
summary: Former San Antonio mayor is seeking to become the nation's first Latino president. WASHINGTON-Former U.S. Housing and Urban Development Secretary Julián Castro formally launched his 2020 presidential campaign Saturday, portraying his candidacy as a next-generation pledge to a diverse nation.

title: Saudi Teen Who Fled Family Begins Settling in Canada
summary: Rahaf Mohammed Alqunun is well and 'very, very happy to be in her new home,' foreign minister says. TORONTO-A young Saudi woman at the center of a dramatic standoff at a Bangkok airport hotel after fleeing her family and renouncing Islam touched down Saturday in Canada, her new home after the Liberal government here offered her refugee status.

title: The 184 MPH Woman
summary: Most Popular News. Ever wondered what it's like to pedal a bicycle at 184 miles per hour? Probably not. It's an eccentric and wild proposition -- not to mention dangerous. But it's precisely what Denise Mueller-Korenek, a former elite junior cyclist and 45-year-old mother of three, attempted last September on the Bonneville Salt Flats in Utah.

title: Congo Opposition Candidate Appeals Election Results
summary: Police on Saturday blocked Mr. Fayulu's supporters outside the constitutional court; 'I won't accept that my victory is stolen,' he said. Democratic Republic of Congo opposition leader Martin Fayulu on Saturday asked the country's constitutional court to order a recount of the Dec. 30 presidential vote to find a successor to President Joseph Kabila.

title: U.S. Seeks to Soothe Turkey Tensions, Pompeo Says
summary: Secretary of state continues his tour of the Middle East, addressing consternation over the U.S.'s Syria pullout. ABU DHABI-The U.S. is working to resolve a dispute with Turkey over its withdrawal from Syria, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said Saturday, adding that it is continuing to negotiate the transfer of military responsibility and the fate of its Kurdish allies.

title: Conservative Group Asks Judge to Halt Albany Lawmakers' Raises
summary: A committee recommended lawmaker base pay increase from $79,500, where it was set for 20 years, to $110,000. A state judge is considering whether to claw back a pay raise for New York state lawmakers that appeared in paychecks this week, reinforcing the uncertainty about compensation for legislators as they begin passing bills.

title: Huawei Fires Executive Charged in Poland With Espionage
summary: Chinese tech company says the employee 'brought Huawei into disrepute'. HONG KONG-Huawei Technologies Co. fired a sales director who was arrested in Poland on espionage charges, saying he brought the Chinese telecom company "into disrepute."

title: French Antigovernment Protesters March for Ninth Straight Weekend
summary: About 80,000 police officers are deployed across the country. PARIS-For the ninth consecutive Saturday, thousands of protesters clad in yellow reflective vests converged on French cities in what is becoming a weekly test of the momentum of their antigovernment movement.

title: Brian Kemp to Take the Helm in Politically Split Georgia
summary: Governor-elect says his mission is to work hard to win over those who didn't vote for him but many remain steadfastly opposed. AUGUSTA, Ga.-Republican Brian Kemp, who is set to be inaugurated Georgia's next governor on Monday, faces the challenge of running a state with an increasingly stark urban-rural divide.

title: Emergency Q&A: How Opponents Could Sue to Block Border Wall
summary: The president has weighed using an emergency declaration to bypass Congress and shift funds to a barrier on Mexico border, but legal challenges are likely to emerge. Critics of the Trump administration say they might sue if the president declares a national emergency to sidestep congressional opposition to his goal of a wall along the Mexican border. How might such litigation play out?

title: Dressing for Deals, Wall Street Bankers Face Fashion Pitfalls
summary: As traditional corporate dress codes fall away, style mistakes have potential to cost business.. Wall Street, the last bastion of traditional corporate dress code, has been loosening its tie-and in some cases, getting rid of it completely-as male bankers increasingly take their sartorial cues from clients.

title: Would Big Pharma Pay for the Wall?
summary: The government shutdown over funding for the border wall may start to put a dent in the prodigious cash flows of big drug and biotech firms. The White House is brainstorming ways to pay for the proposed wall along the southern border of the U.S.

title: Vanguard to Pull Trading Plug on About 400 Products
summary: The fund giant says it will no longer allow new purchases on about 400 funds and securities. Vanguard Group will no longer allow individual investors to make new trades on certain investments that seek to magnify bets, pouring cold water on strategies that became popular after the last financial crisis.

title: In Fast-Aging Japan, Elder Care Is a High-Tech Pursuit
summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-Takahiro Taniguchi was walking down the hall at the home for senior citizens where he works when his wireless earbuds signaled him: A resident was ready to be escorted to the bathroom.

title: Cloud Should Shine for Amazon, Microsoft Earnings
summary: The world's two most valuable companies have high expectations to meet in the coming earnings season. Can Amazon.com and Microsoft keep their cloud businesses growing strong? It's the new $1.6 trillion question.

title: 'Epic Abstraction' Review: High Expectations and Trepidations
summary: The new long-term exhibition of Abstract Expressionist works at the Met shows masters alongside lesser-knowns with mixed results..

title: Staying Fit With the Help of a Horse Named Boogie Woogie
summary: Petra Hilleberg, a small-business CEO, competes in dressage, commonly described as equine ballet. Boogie Woogie is an apt name for a dance partner, and in many ways, that's exactly what Petra Hilleberg's horse is to her.

title: SpaceX to Cut 10% of Workforce
summary: Company cites costly challenges in developing interplanetary spacecraft and global, space-based internet. Elon Musk's SpaceX plans to reduce its workforce by 10%, or roughly 600 employees, even as the company seeks to ramp up ambitious projects to develop a super-powerful rocket and deploy thousands of advanced satellites.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: The Way You'll Be Making Scrambled Eggs From Now On
summary: For the most luscious, custardy consistency, borrow this method from the chefs at Nonesuch in Oklahoma City. Their recipe includes sides of butter-braised potatoes and prosciutto. YOU MIGHT CALL IT fast food slow. At the buzzy Oklahoma City restaurant Nonesuch, chefs Colin Stringer and Jeremy Wolfe raise the simplest of dishes, scrambled eggs, to another level entirely. The secret is taking your time and cooking them gently in a double boiler, much as you would a hollandaise, for a creamy, meltingly delicate consistency. "You can't rush it," Mr. Stringer said. "And you have to whisk constantly."

title: Help! My Boss Is El Chapo
summary: The trial of the alleged drug kingpin offers a glimpse of how he managed people. On a makeshift gravel runway near the Mexican city of Durango, Joaquín Guzmán Loera, better known as El Chapo, climbed out of his damaged Cessna 206 feeling lucky to be alive.

title: The Big Hangup: Why the Future Is Not Just Your Phone
summary: The once-revolutionary smartphone is losing its power to amaze-and maybe its singular hold on our lives. Steve Jobs took to a stage a dozen years ago this week to introduce a revolutionary new product to the world: the first Apple iPhone.

title: U.S. Moves Some Cargo From Syria but Pace of Withdrawal Uncertain
summary: Logistical and support troops have moved into Syria. WASHINGTON-The U.S. military has begun moving equipment out of Syria as it pushes forward on President Trump's order to withdraw forces, but planners are still working out details of how and when more than 2,000 troops will leave, defense officials said Friday.

title: Megyn Kelly Is Released From Her NBC News Contract
summary: Former 'Today' host paid the full value of her $69 million contract. Megyn Kelly is a free agent.

title: Disney CEO's Pay Surges
summary: A rise in stock awards contributed to the increase in compensation. Walt Disney Co. Chief Executive Robert Iger saw the value of his total compensation last year surge 81% to $65.6 million, the company said in a securities filing Friday.

title: Trump Administration Plans Effort to Let States Remodel Medicaid
summary: System could resemble block grant proposals favored by conservatives. The Trump administration is readying guidance that could let states remodel their Medicaid programs to more closely resemble block grant proposals favored by Republicans during their failed effort to repeal the Affordable Care Act, according to people familiar with the discussions.

title: Chernova's Take: New Fund Aims to Make Investment in Vice Attractive
summary: In her debut, New York venture investor Catharine Dockery looks to raise $25 million to back liquor, tobacco and cannabis startups. Stop moralizing. Indulge. Make money.

title: Mother of American Jailed in Iran Pleads for His Release
summary: Navy veteran Michael White's mother says her son has life-threatening cancer. WASHINGTON-A U.S. Navy veteran who has been jailed in Iran on undisclosed charges suffers from cancer and may die without access to medical care, according to his mother, who pleaded for his release in a statement on Friday.

title: Apple Plans Three New iPhones This Year, Plays Catch-Up on Cameras
summary: Highest-end model includes triple rear camera; one will be successor to the struggling XR. Apple Inc. is planning to release three new iPhone models again this fall, including a successor to the struggling XR, the lower priced 2018 device with a liquid-crystal display that has fallen short of Apple's sales expectations, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand Staffs Up for Likely 2020 Presidential Run
summary: New York Democrat signs up key staff members, plans first trip to Iowa. WASHINGTON-New York Democratic Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand is closing in on announcing a 2020 presidential campaign, signing up key staff members and planning her first trip to Iowa, according to people familiar with the plans.

title: Pompeo's Words, Trump's Withdrawal
summary: The vow to 'expel every last Iranian boot' in Syria rings hollow.. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo delivered a fine speech in Cairo on Thursday trying to reassure allies that the U.S. is determined to remain a player in the Middle East and contain Iran in particular. The problem is that this ambition clashes with the reality of his boss's contradictory message about American intentions.

title: BlackRock Elevates Potential Successor to CEO Laurence Fink
summary: Mark Wiedman will head the company's international operations and corporate strategy. A potential successor to BlackRock Chief Executive Laurence Fink has been elevated to a new job that gives him more power inside the world's biggest asset manager.

title: California's Next Ban: Paper Receipts
summary: Helping hometown companies in the name of green virtue.. First they came for the plastic bags, then plastic straws. Now California progressives want to ban paper receipts. Like so many other liberal crusades, the fight against paper receipts is cronyism masquerading as green virtue.

title: Energy Stocks, Long a Market Drag, Lead Way in 2019
summary: Sector is S&P 500's best performer of year as oil rallies, investors bet shares are undervalued. Shares of energy companies have surged out of the gate this year, climbing alongside a rally in oil prices after a bruising end to 2018.
